website_summaries.verdict: While the Canon EOS Rebel SL1 is a perfectly reasonable entry-level dSLR, you can get the same photo and video quality in a smaller body for the same money (or less) by opting for a mirrorless interchangeable-lens model.
pros: Sized for small-to-medium hands, the Canon EOS Rebel SL1 delivers the expected photo and video quality in a comfortable and well-executed design

customer_reviews.title: I've owned this for two years now and it has been the best companion on my adventures
customer_reviews.text: Over the last two years I've become very fond of this little guy. Last week I finally decided to replace it and bought a 77d. The 77d is going back, my sl1 is better. Words can't describe how great this camera has been, but my pictures can. Please take a look (all shot on my sl1)
customer_reviews.author: Mr E

customer_reviews.title: and I love it so far
customer_reviews.text: This was my first DSLR camera, and I love it so far. I purchased it about 3 weeks ago before a vacation to Dubai and my pictures were amazing. After only a few weeks I still do not know how to use all the features but I'm learning. The camera itself is very user friendly with many automatic settings and pre-set settings. The size is also nice, not to heavy to carry around all day and fit nicely in my crossbody purse. Overall I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: jackattack7

customer_reviews.title: Great deal excellent condition
customer_reviews.text: Stated in description as Very good quality. Have to say, it is in excellent quality. Happily surprised. Turned on without any issues, works like a charm. Low shutter count, below 900! Battery is aftermarket but keeps charge well. Charger Canon, it does bothers me the full charge light constantly on, when plugged in, regardless if it has a battery in or not. It is it's design, newer charger I have doesn't do that. If I could have any wish with it, would be a camera strap for sure. I had to make one in the hurry, where we live, no store carries straps or camera accessories in2 hr drive distance (one way). Overall very happy with the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Lidia's T.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Alternative
customer_reviews.text: The SL 1 is a less expensive alternative to some of the mirror-less, fixed lens cameras that have become so popular. With its APS-C sensor and 18 megapixel resolution, it is adequate for most ordinary shooting situations. It appealed to me because my kit is all Canon, and my current lens fit on it. Coupled with my 40mm pancake lens (one of these days I'll get a wider lens), it has become my walking around camera when I don't want to lug my 5D around. Some people have complained that its small size makes it somewhat awkward to use, but I haven't found that to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a professional and I have tiny hands so this is perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: When this camera came out and they were calling it "World's smallest and lightest digital SLR", I knew I had to have it. I'm not a professional and I have tiny hands so this is perfect for me. I use it most for indoor pictures of my family with the Canon EF-S 24mm f/2.8 STM lens, no flash.
customer_reviews.author: Gertrude Hunsucker

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a less obvious body to use with my Canon lens. My main Canon is a Eos 5 Mk III. This is much much smaller and when used with my 40MM pancake lens is almost like a point and shoot in size. It is a full quality SLR that takes all Canon lens. I have no complaint about picture quality. It does not have some of the features of the 5 Mk III, but at around 15% of the cost, you can't have everything. It works very well for any type of pictures.
customer_reviews.author: eleckh

customer_reviews.title: Terrific compact DSLR that works with most all my Canon and third party lenses
customer_reviews.text: Started with a Digital Rebel 10 years ago then upgraded to a Canon 40D. More recently went full frame with a Canon MK5-IIID and earlier this year added the new 70D. All these new editions are great but bigger body's than my original Rebel. Wanted a small compact body for travel, yet use many of the lenses I already own. This camera fits the bill perfectly. Takes all my Canon mount lenses is even smaller than my original Rebel and has ISO performance close to my new 70D. I would recommend this body to anyone that want the flexibility and image quality a DSLR can deliver yet wants a smaller profile.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Tons of quality in a tiny package!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how much DSLR you can get for your money these days. I owned a Canon 7D for a long time. Of course its build quality was superior to the SL1, and it could shoot faster bursts, but the image quality, metering, autofocus, etc on this tiny little DSLR is just as good as the 7D. It's a great second camera to my 6D, allowing me to take two bodies while traveling so that I have to do less changing of lenses. Some people complain about the battery life. I have found the battery life to be ok -- nothing great like my 6D, but not horrendous either. Just buy a second battery...
customer_reviews.author: thekingb

customer_reviews.title: Not better than my old camera
customer_reviews.text: My previous camera was a T3i which in my opinion was a better overall camera. I like the option to flip the screen(this camera does not give you that option to do so) and also when I used an older version of Adobe I did not have any issues with opening RAW file(this camera has all kind of issues with that). Honestly, I can not really name anything I like about this camera over my old T3i except for it works, not better but it just works.
customer_reviews.author: QuyDaddi

customer_reviews.title: ... from my canon rebel xl & it is a GREAT camera. I do photography as a hobby mostly ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an upgrade (after reading several reviews and specs) from my canon rebel xl & it is a GREAT camera. I do photography as a hobby mostly & take portraits of my children a lot and this camera has great quality photos, obviously and improvement from my 10 yr. old dslr. It does everything you'd expect a dslr to do. It does not have wifi capabilities, but it says that if you read before purchasing. It allows you to take photos while recording a video, which is nice, but the video does cut-out when you do so. Overall, it's a great camera!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle B.

customer_reviews.title: ... hole but the pictures still come out clear n amazing. The quality of the pictures are even better ...
customer_reviews.text: Camera looks BAND NEW only complaint is doesn't look clear when using the peek hole but the pictures still come out clear n amazing . The quality of the pictures are even better if you buy a flash. I have 3 canons the T3i & the T6i but I have to say my ultimate favorite is of now 4-30-2017 is this little guy sl1 by far much better quality pix especially using the 24mm or 50mm with really good light . Pictures come out amazing!
customer_reviews.author: janette guidoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight camera if you're willing to sacrifice quality.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good camera, I've been spoiled by the 40D and 60D quality so this doesn't quite cut it, but it's great for a starter camera. Super lightweight but I decided I was willing to take something heavier and not have to sacrifice quality, so I didn't end up taking this on the trip I bought it for. Overall a good lightweight camera if you're willing to sacrifice some quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift that was well received. He took it on a hiking trip with a buddy who had an older model Rebel. The friend kept wanting to use the lighter weight new camera. Only thing missing from this package was a filter. So far has lived up to expectations. The pictures of Sequoia National Park are breathtaking.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. TCA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent size and price, with advantages of higher priced DSLRs
customer_reviews.text: The SL1 performance is a wonderful experience which i was not expecting from such a compact DSLR. Thumbs up to Canon for this ( I am a novice photographer). Movie mode, quite lens (18-55 IS STM), quick AF, touch screen along with simple menu, compact size of SL1 (benefits of APSC DSLR), and image quality are some outstanding features. It would have been simply outstanding if articulating screen and WiFi feature were also present (no regrets on the good quality of touch screen tough IMO). Recommend for those looking for consistently good images, live view shooting, AF in movie mode and benefits of APSC DSLR in a roughly mirror-less camera compact size.
customer_reviews.author: aatir

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the "family" photographer
customer_reviews.text: this is the 4th Canon EOS camera I have had. Each has been an incremental upgrade. I though this would be the same, however, this camera represents a significant step up from the T series cameras. It's compact size is a little interesting to get used to when it is paired with a larger lens - the lens weighs more than the camera. Photo quality and its ability to handle a variety of light conditions with few changes make it the ideal for taking sharp photos of the grand kids on the move. Love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fit
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a reasonably priced DSLR that is capable of taking nice photos but I also wanted something that wasn't too bulky and didn't feel like a toy. This SL1 fits my requirements nicely. It is a little bulkier than a GT6 it replaces but not by much. The SL1 fits nicely in my hand and the primary buttons and dials are easy to reach. The only two faults I have with it is that the screen doesn't articulate and the Fstop and shutter are set using the same dial meaning that you can't really control both while looking through the viewfinder. Overall, I'm pleased with this camera and would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: but I'll say that this camera is a perfect gear for a comfortable use
customer_reviews.text: There are many reviews of technical features. There's no need to add one more, but I'll say that this camera is a perfect gear for a comfortable use. It's better that what I expected. This is the camera that I carry everywhere now. Perfect size, outstanding performance. Now I keep my heavy weight gears ( full frames) just for special assignments, mostly portraits and fashion. I recommend this camera to any amateur or professional. It won't dissapoint you. After years of dedication to photography I found the perfect light camera...reflex.
customer_reviews.author: Nanin

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time researching cameras for great family shots. it came down to portability, brand reputation and past experiences. I have owned a Canon G9 for several years and it has been extremely durable but I wanted more flexibility as I learned to take better photos. I used the SL1 at Christmas (2013) and I love it the photos using only the built in flash and auto setting were excellent. I saw a demo on line that recommended the 18-55mm lens to start as you learn the camera and I would agree. I would not hesitate to recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: So happy I waited until this lightweight, easy-to-use gem came along!
customer_reviews.text: So wonderful and easy to use! I have owned 4 previous SLRs in my life - only 1 previous was a DSLR. I love how lightweight this is, how easy the user interface is, how great the back touchscreen works...Oh yeah, the pictures! Love what it has taken so far. I can shoot in all sorts of light using the Tv setting. With 1/80 shutter I can get a sharp shot indoors and not use flash. And the HDR feature is so fun to play with. If you have been hesitant to get a DSLR due to size and weight THIS camera will fit the bill. I have small hands (female, 48, 126lb) and this camera fits them very well.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Katz

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Going from a 60D to save space, initially it feels a little small and strange with the smaller handle, but it takes great pictures. I plan to do a side by side comparison with my 60D. If the picture quality is truly the same, I will be selling the 60D. The only thing I wish Canon would change is the LCD is basically useless unless you use a tripod This is true on all Canon SLR I have used. The video is clear, but the constant focusing is a challenge for these SLR cameras. I wouldn't buy it with the intent of using it for video often.
customer_reviews.author: MooVit11

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: And I mean little, I was expecting small but when I unpacked it I was surprised. I have pretty big hands and find the camera easy to use though I can see how some people might find it to be a bit too small for them. Image quality is great, especially when I have my EF 400mm f/5.6L or EF 500mm f/4L IS USM mounted. This will be a great backup body for when I travel since it is small and weighs so little. I only wish it had microfocus adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Greg L

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Entry-Level DSLR for Professional/Hobbyist Photography!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first DSLR camera I have ever owned, and I'm incredibly happy with the quality of the images. I have it with the standard 18/35mm lens and it has greatly increased my interest in doing professional photography. I've found that it's helped me with understanding the more technical features of cameras, and through experimentation I have taken some rather stunning photographs. People are paying attention, and it sounds like soon they will be paying me.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: great entrylevel DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice photographer, learning to piece together the things it takes to take a good picture. Most of my shots are landscape. The Canon SL1 with its smaller footprint, fits into my hands quite well. The quality of the pics I've taken so far have been GREAT but mostly experimental as I am still figuring out the controls of the SL1. The camera is lightweight, I have been using either a Canon 50mm 1.8 lense or a Canon 35-80mm lens for my landscape shots. I believe that this camera will fill the bill for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Cichocki

customer_reviews.title: wonderful camera. who needs mirrorless?
customer_reviews.text: The best camera is the one you have with you when you need to take a photo. This is the smallest, lightest DSLR and I love it. I have a Peak Design clip for my shoulder bag and have this little gem attached all the time with a 24mm pancake lens.
customer_reviews.author: JTerran

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this little thing! Put quality glass on it and you can't go wrong! As the saying goes, date the camera but marry the glass! I bought this as an everyday camera so I wouldn't be lugging my beloved 6d everywhere, and I have even used it at 2 weddings with specialty lenses on it such as the 100L macro and it performs beautifully! The ISO performance is on the same par as the 5d mark 2 (which I owned before the 6d) and doesn't compare to my 6d however, but with fast glass and good light it's a perfect little gem!
customer_reviews.author: jBrooke

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love love love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love love love this camera. I have had it for a year and when I compare this to my other rebel cameras is obvious that this surpasses. Pictures are cleaner, clearer, more vibrant. The touch screen is a plus! The settings have a few more selections that come in handy. It's smaller and much lighter than most rebels.
customer_reviews.author: c Rivera

customer_reviews.title: This camera was great and fully functional
customer_reviews.text: This camera was great and fully functional. There was no appearance of being used at all. All of the items came including official copy of cannon verification and warranty and all handbooks that originally came with the product. It's a great camera and great for beginners. Any advice on the type of camera you want, should be researched before purchase! Would recommend this seller to anyone interested in purchasing this item!
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Koga

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: I don't have sufficient experience with this yet to be certain, but so far this camera is superb. I am not a PRO so my demands may not equal the readers, but I am very fussy. I like it's light weight and smaller size. It is very straight forward to use in both manual and auto modes. So far, the auto settings are similar to ones I set, when different, the camera was better. I like the fact that it uses the lenses I bought over the years for my old 6 MP Rebel. I loved that camera and this one is better in so many ways.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Morse

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the Canon sl1 for a few months now and it hasn't disappointed me! It's a great small compact camera for all of your dslr photography. I have done various shots with it such as Landscape, astrophotography etc. and it works great. Great camera over all! if you plan on getting into photography seriously you will most likely grow out of the lense that comes with it and possibly the camera itself.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Great quality camera and photos
customer_reviews.text: Photography became a hobby. This camera is easy to use, takes excellent photos, & propelled this hobby into an income. When you are ready for more than an iPhone camera, this camera is will meet your needs and exceed your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Welshhans

customer_reviews.title: Love This Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I am a novice & am writing this review a little late...have owned this camera for about a year now. For a non-professional this camera is very easy to use (after reading the instruction manual). The picture quality is far superior to any other cameras I have owned in the past (although, admittedly, this is my first SLR). I purchased this on recommendation from a professional photographer & couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton S.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent camera. I have never owned a DSLR camera before and this one exceeded my expectations. It is easy to use and far lighter than I expected. It is small, but that is part of the reason that I got it. It is very easy use and to carry around. Buying the 75-300mm lens was worth it as I take a lot of wildlife photos and would be lost without it, but this lens does not have image stabilization so you have to be more careful when focusing. I recommend using a tripod. I highly recommend this camera for those just starting out who do not want to sacrifice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Adams

customer_reviews.title: A screaming deal on a great camera and accessories
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this package for a trip to the grand canyon and nearby national parks. The camera did not disappoint and I found all of the accessories to be useful despite the fact that they were basically free. The tripod, camera case, and filter packs all came in very handy. The 18-55 lens was all I needed 95% of the time but I did use the longer zoom lens a few times and it worked great too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a camera. I have purchased many cameras over the years most were Canon. Never have I taken onr the first day, and shot stage scenes without some diffi ulties. Not with this on. The pictures are crisp and the camera easy to operate. Love it. It was delivered the next day. Very pleased with service.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine L. Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value/ Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the value this camera brings to the table. I am a novice photographer with a baby on the way. This camera is everything we could have asked for. It's small and lightweight. I am an average sized guy and I don't mind the size. The photo quality is amazing and I can't wait to use it more. I will come back here after a few months to review it after I have used it for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Eric m

customer_reviews.title: This is an Awesome Powerful DSLR.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I would not have to haul out my big 5D MK II. I could use almost all of my current equipment and have a much smaller camera body that was family event friendly and still give me excellent image quality. So far I have not been disappointed. The interface is very intuitive, the camera feels solid and your hands and fingers seem to just fit right where they need to go. I love the image quality and enjoy this camera more and more as I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin J Buffington

customer_reviews.title: Seller didn’t disclose that there is some physical damage on the body.
customer_reviews.text: Seller didn’t disclose that there is some physical damage on the body. Still Works well & very light weight. I was on travel so I couldn’t return this during the window allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Karizaila38

customer_reviews.title: Great light camera!
customer_reviews.text: As I get older, my beloved Nikons get too heavy too quickly. I was skeptical, because I had had a Rebel before and wasn't too happy with it, but this camera produces crisp photos and has a body so light I forget I am carrying a camera. There is no reason to limit yourself to a little point and shoot or your phone when you can take high quality shots with a variety of lenses. I totally recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: A. Conte

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE MY CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: I was more than a little worried purchasing my first DSLR and a second hand no less, but it turned out to be very good! And the seller was was honest and I got everything I expected. The camera itself is in very good condition and functions well. With varying lens I’ve gotten exceptional pictures so far! While it is not the latest it proves to be pretty amazing all the same.
customer_reviews.author: Liv

customer_reviews.title: nice picture and video quality. small and lightweight camera
customer_reviews.text: The pictures and videos are great. The touch interface seems as nice or nicer than most cameras though I still think that there is lots of room for improvement there. My main pain point was the lack of a flip-out viewing screen. Without this, it is hard to hold the camera high or low or at some other angle and record video and take pictures. I also like how small lightweight and small the camera is.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Morris

customer_reviews.title: I think the only thing I would recommend is buying an eye piece (you can get them ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm loving this camera! I've taken it on a couple of trips, and after a bit of practice (learning the features, reading the instruction manual, etc.), I have to say that it is VERY user-friendly. I think the only thing I would recommend is buying an eye piece (you can get them for just a few bucks), because, from my experience, when you use the eye piece that came with the camera, your nose will mush against the display (oh yeah, I bought a screen protector as well).
customer_reviews.author: Leonard P Muhammad

customer_reviews.title: Looooooove this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I researched SLR cameras for over month and finally decided on this one and I'm so happy with my decision. This camera rocks my world! It's so easy to use and takes awesome pictures. I've never had an SLR camera before so I don't really have much to compare it too, but this camera is perfect for a newbie like myself. Plus it's much smaller than other cameras of its kind, which is great since I have small hands. I highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Erika Fradella

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice little SLR
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice little SLR. It does everything I wanted it to do - at an entry level price range. I am an experienced but not serious photographer. I paired it with the 17-55 f2.8 zoom and that is a good combo. It feels solid and looks high quality. Very ergonomical in my average sized hand. Battery life is good.
customer_reviews.author: blizmag

customer_reviews.title: Total casual photo taker
customer_reviews.text: I consulted a photographer friend when making my purchase. I upgraded from the rebel xsi I bought in 2008. The new camera is small, uses the lenses I bought for my previous camera, has a touch screen, and does video. It was a big upgrade for me since my old model was not that impressive of a dslr and it cost me less then that camera did years ago. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: StaticScribble

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera, small yet mighty, fully functional and easy
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera---my new go to. Canon still has the best CMOS sensor, best stabiizer system, easiest full functional menu. Tried a Nikon and just could not get used to their complex not user friendly interface---back to safe and easy yet fully functional Canon. And yes this thing is very small compared to other models
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Foster

customer_reviews.title: broken, never worked. Must have been refurbished sold as new.
customer_reviews.text: This camera never worked properly. The autofocus never worked and the settings were all off. I spent a lot of time resetting it etc so unfortunately I can't return it b/c I waited too long but this must have been broken, returned and refurbished and sold as new. Don't buy from this seller!!!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Jones

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't in love with it when i got it and there was ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't in love with it when i got it and there was some kind of dust that was stuck in the mirror. I had to use all different methods to get it out because it got in the way of my view. However the other parts of the camera were nice and the seller communicated very well with me. Shipped pretty fast and i am pleased with the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: So far - it's great
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this camera for a month but I like it. Without getting into technical detail (there are plenty of reviews for that) it is very light and comfortable to use. I have had Canon cameras in the past so this was very easy to operate. Bottom line, it's light, simple to use, takes great photos and has plenty of options for adjusting your exposures. I hope to update this review in six months.
customer_reviews.author: Jayebee

customer_reviews.title: Huge step up
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't updated my dslr for 4 years or so. This one is better in almost every way. I like the high iso settings, the movie mode (although with the internal microphone you hear the motor if you use autofocus), the ability to use the lcd to view a picture when I am shooting macro, and the when using the lcd that I can zoom in 10X so I can fine focus.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pictures on Auto setting
customer_reviews.text: I haven't taken this off of Auto setting yet. I am new to cameras. I like it because it takes great pictures on Auto and it is so light-weight that my arthritic fingers have something to hold on to that isn't heavy. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: So, so, SO IN LOVE with this camera! World’s smallest DSLR, cheap price AND great quality. It truly doesn’t get better than this. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Ny

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners not good for people with big hands though
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Camera
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this camera. It weighs less and is smaller than my other Canon DSLR making it easy to carry and a pleasure to use. Of course, the photographs taken with this camera are excellent. Video is good also.
customer_reviews.author: Photojo

customer_reviews.title: I'm a very big fan of this camera. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a very big fan of this camera. I had an old DSLR that needed an upgrade and this camera does just what I need it to do. Solid DSLR for beginners but still has all of the fancy offerings of more expensive cameras. I just wish it had a pull out screen but you can't have it all!
customer_reviews.author: Rick44

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase. Wish it auto focused a little faster, as well as in low light...you can't force the flash/shutter in the dark like I used to be able to do with my 70D years ago. I imagine that's what you get when you pay a little more. Great starter DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stapp

customer_reviews.title: like the legendary Tokina 11-16 and the near-L quality EF ...
customer_reviews.text: Combine the SL1 (aka 100D) with the EF-S 18-135 IS STM lens and you have a truly travel friendly full fledge APS-C DSLR. Yes, I have more lenses: like the legendary Tokina 11-16 and the near-L quality EF 70-300 IS USM but when traveling I don't want to have to be carrying and changing lenses around. Also, if you are considering the T5 or T5i, you are better off with the SL1. Better specs than both of them sans the tilt screen of the T5i This combination will serve you very well, step up your photography skills and you won't miss a thing while traveling light!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect camera for me. It's much lighter and easier to hold than other models. I am not a expert by any means, but I have found the set up to be easy and taking pictures is a breeze. The quality of the images is also excellent. Great camera for the incidental photographer.
customer_reviews.author: P.M.

customer_reviews.title: great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I normally shoot with a 5Dmkiii but I needed something to walk around with and not worry about. This camera fits the bill. It is very small and light weight. Image quality is good. All the features you need. For the price it was a really good deal.
customer_reviews.author: RudiHolt

customer_reviews.title: It has many nice features that helps you take some very nice pictures
customer_reviews.text: I bough this camera as my first DSLR camera and as for today I think that it was a wise buy. This camera is very user friendly, It has many nice features that helps you take some very nice pictures. The kit lens provide great results relative to other kit lens and the fact that you can zoom while filming a video makes it outstanding. Add to that that it is very small DSLR camera and you got your self the best camera to start with if you want to start and take some nice pictures. Cons: 1.The viewer screen is fixed (can't be rotated). 2. It has no built in wi-fi
customer_reviews.author: Ido

customer_reviews.title: The new offering from canon - SL1
customer_reviews.text: What a great little camera. Easy to use features. Love the description that comes up on the display when you select a feature. product_meta.title: Canon EOS Rebel SL1 Digital SLR Camera (Body Only)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:Body Only| Configuration:Base 

IGNITE YOUR IMAGINATION
As the world's smallest and lightest digital SLR*, the new EOS Rebel SL1 is small in size but enormous in performance. With a newly-designed Canon 18.0 Megapixel CMOS (APS-C) sensor and speedy Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor, it delivers images of extraordinary quality – ideal for those stepping up from a smartphone or compact camera. An impressive ISO range of 100–12800 (expandable to H: 25600) for stills and 100–6400 (expandable to H: 12800) for video plus up to 4.0 fps continuous shooting make this camera the go-to for any photo opportunity, even in dim lighting or when capturing fast action subjects. And Hybrid CMOS AF II delivers accurate AF tracking during Live View shooting, helping ensure your photos and movies are crisp and clear. The EOS Rebel SL1 makes amazing movies with Canon EOS Full HD Movie Mode with Movie Servo AF, working in concert with Canon STM lenses for smooth and quiet continuous AF. In addition to its Optical Viewfinder, the EOS Rebel SL1 has a bright, wide Touch Screen 3.0" Clear View LCD monitor II, perfect for viewing a number of special scene modes and Creative Filters available in real-time display. Here is the DSLR you'll want to bring with you everyday and ignite your imagination!

* Among digital SLR cameras that use APS-C size equivalent sensors. As of March 1, 2013, based on Canon's research.

AMAZING CAPTURE AND PROCESSING POWER, ASTONISHINGLY COMPACT.
WORLD'S SMALLEST AND LIGHTEST DIGITAL SLR*
For ultra portability with a minimal footprint, the EOS Rebel SL1 is the world's smallest and lightest digital SLR*. Weighing in at approximately 13 ounces, the EOS Rebel SL1's astonishingly compact size does not compromise its excellent performance as a member of the Canon EOS family: it features an 18.0 Megapixel CMOS (APS-C) sensor, the speedy DIGIC 5 Image Processor, a wide ISO range for both stills and video, and advanced AF performance. Designed for entry-level DSLR users, the EOS Rebel SL1 ensures performance and operation while still remaining compact.

18.0 MEGAPIXEL CMOS (APS-C) SENSOR
The EOS Rebel SL1 features a newly-developed Canon 18.0 Megapixel CMOS (Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor) sensor in the world's smallest and lightest digital SLR*. Perfect for enlargements or for cropping detailed portions of the composition, the camera's sensor captures images with exceptional clarity and tonal range. This first-class sensor features many of the same technologies used by professional Canon cameras to maximize each pixel's light-gathering efficiency and has center pixels that aid in the EOS Rebel SL1's accurate AF performance. This APS-C size sensor creates an effective 1.6x field of view (compared to 35mm format).

ISO 100–12800 (EXPANDABLE TO H: 25600) FOR STILLS; ISO 100–6400 (EXPANDABLE TO H: 12800) FOR VIDEOS
Thanks to its DIGIC 5 Image Processor, the EOS Rebel SL1 features an ISO range of ISO 100–12800 (expandable to H: 25600) for stills and ISO 100–6400 (expandable to H: 12800) for videos that makes shooting possible in situations previously unthinkable without flash. The EOS Rebel SL1, with the DIGIC 5 Image Processor's remarkable noise-reduction technology, performs brilliantly in low-light shooting. Used with one of Canon's EF or EF-S lenses with Optical Image Stabilizer, the EOS Rebel SL1 can record beautiful images and video even when light sources are scarce.

DIGIC 5 IMAGE PROCESSOR
The EOS Rebel SL1's DIGIC 5 Image Processor works with the camera's CMOS sensor to deliver images with incredible detail in more situations, without the need for artificial light sources. With the power of the DIGIC 5 Image Processor, the EOS Rebel SL1 can achieve higher ISO sensitivity, can shoot up to 4.0 fps continuously and can even perform advanced functions like displaying art filters in real time, new scene modes, lens correction and much more. The camera's brilliant imaging core supercharges every facet of still and moving image capture.

* Among digital SLR cameras that use APS-C size equivalent sensors. As of March 1, 2013, based on Canon's research.

NEVER MISS A MOMENT!
HIGH-SPEED CONTINUOUS SHOOTING
The EOS Rebel SL1 can shoot up to 4.0 frames per second (fps) for up to approximately 7 consecutive RAW files or approximately 28 full-resolution JPEGs. Shooting at speeds of up to 1/4000 sec., the EOS Rebel SL1 can capture even rapidly unfolding scenes with ease.

TRUE HD PERFORMANCE, REBEL SIMPLICITY.
EOS FULL HD MOVIE MODE WITH MOVIE SERVO AF
The EOS Rebel SL1 offers easy-to-use, professional video capture without compromise. Capable of shooting in a number of recording sizes and frame rates, the EOS Rebel SL1 offers outstanding video capturing performance, quality and simplicity. The EOS Rebel SL1 enables easy manual control of exposure, focus and Live View features, even in-camera editing! Movie Servo AF allows continuous autofocus tracking of moving subjects while recording video. When shooting video with one of Canon's STM lenses, Movie Servo AF takes advantage of the lens' stepping motor for smooth and quiet continuous AF. With an STM lens attached, the EOS Rebel SL1 meets high standards for SLR moviemaking performance!

BUILT-IN MONAURAL MICROPHONE, MANUAL AUDIO LEVEL ADJUSTMENT
The EOS Rebel SL1 has an internal monaural microphone for audio capture and a wind filter feature to reduce wind noise when shooting outdoors. Sound recording levels can be manually (up to 64 different levels) or automatically controlled. A built-in attenuator is also provided to reduce audio clipping. For more advanced audio recording, the EOS Rebel SL1 is compatible with many third-party electret condenser microphones with a 3.5mm diameter plug.

VIDEO SNAPSHOT
With the Video Snapshot feature, the EOS Rebel SL1 can capture short video clips (of 2, 4 or 8 seconds) then combine them automatically into one video file as a snapshot or highlights "album". With no editing needed after shooting, the compiled video is perfect for sharing online or displaying directly on an HDTV via the camera's HDMI port. Additionally, stills can be recorded during video shooting simply by pressing the camera's shutter button. During playback, video clips in an album can be reordered or deleted.

MULTI-TOUCH, BRILLIANT VIEW.
TOUCH SCREEN WIDE 3.0-INCH CLEAR VIEW LCD MONITOR II WITH MULTI-TOUCH OPERATION AND TOUCH AF
Using capacitive touch screen technology similar to today's popular mobile devices, the EOS Rebel SL1's gorgeous LCD monitor is touch-sensitive, delivering intuitive operation with ease. Two-finger touch gestures can be used for zooming or changing images. Menu and quick control settings can be accessed, and focus point and shutter release can be activated with the touch of a fingertip using Touch AF. Displaying fine detail (at approximately 1.04 million dots), the camera's Touch Screen Wide 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor II is perfect for composing and reviewing images. Thanks to a new, solid construction between the monitor's resin-coated cover and the liquid crystal display, reflections are minimized, and the display can be viewed, without glare, from any number of angles. The LCD's surface is treated with a smudge-resistant coating to minimize fingerprints and to maintain a bright, clear image display.

OPTICAL VIEWFINDER WITH APPROX. 0.87X MAGNIFICATION
In addition to its amazing multi-touch screen, the EOS Rebel SL1 also sports an Optical Viewfinder, ideal for composing shots when shooting in bright conditions or capturing the moment as it unfolds. Shooting with the Optical Viewfinder also ensures steadier images. The viewfinder displays exposure, AF, flash, plus other relevant image information right along with the image. The 0.87x magnification factor ensures that subjects are easier to find and track.

INNOVATIVE AF SOLUTIONS FOR CONSISTENTLY EXCELLENT PERFORMANCE.
9-POINT AF SYSTEM (INCLUDING A HIGH-PRECISION DUAL-CROSS F/2.8 CENTER POINT)
When shooting through the viewfinder, the EOS Rebel SL1 has exceptional autofocus with a sophisticated 9-point AF system, including a high-precision dual-cross f/2.8 center point, for accurate focus whether the camera is oriented in portrait or landscape position. A proven AI Servo AF system achieves and maintains consistent focus with an exceptional degree of reliability.

HYBRID CMOS AF II
Canon's amazing Hybrid CMOS AF System is perfect for shooting photos and video in Live View. Combining two different kinds of AF – phase and contrast detection – and aided by pixels on the camera's CMOS sensor that assist in predicting subject location, continuous focus tracking becomes faster and more accurate than ever before in Live View. And with the EOS Rebel SL1 you'll get Hybrid CMOS AF II, which provides the same fantastic performance as the original but boasts an increased AF area that covers approximately 80% of the sensor for easier composition. This performance is enhanced further by Canon's line of STM lenses, which provide smooth and quiet operation.

COMPLEX FUNCTIONS MADE SIMPLE.
SCENE INTELLIGENT AUTO MODE
The EOS Rebel SL1 features Scene Intelligent Auto mode, which incorporates a number of Canon technologies to deliver the best possible exposure. Joining Picture Style Auto, Automatic Lighting Optimizer, Automatic White Balance, Autofocus, and Automatic Exposure, Scene Intelligent Auto mode analyzes the image, accounting for faces, colors, brightness, moving objects, contrast, even whether the camera is handheld or on a tripod, and then chooses the exposure and enhancements that bring out the best in any scene or situation. Users without extensive photography knowledge or experience will not need to puzzle over settings; the Scene Intelligent Auto mode simplifies DSLR image capture so photographers can simply concentrate on composing images.

CREATIVE FEATURES, AMAZING IMAGES.
ADVANCED CREATIVE FILTERS THAT CAN BE DISPLAYED IN REAL TIME DURING LIVE VIEW SHOOTING
Adding to the fun and creative possibilities available with the EOS Rebel SL1, the camera offers seven different creative filters for still images: Art Bold Effect, Water Painting Effect, Miniature Effect, Fisheye Effect, Grainy B/W, Soft Focus and Toy Camera Effect. Each effect can be applied in three different levels (low, standard and strong), and easily previewed on the LCD panel during Live View shooting. The EOS Rebel SL1 also features the new Miniature Effect for Movies. You will be amazed and delighted by the artistry that these creative filters will allow you to create.

EFFECT SHOT MODE AND BACKGROUND SIMULATION
Among the dynamic new features designed to make creative photography both intuitive and fun, the EOS Rebel SL1 has Background Simulation, which makes it easy for beginners to achieve dramatic blurred or sharpened backgrounds. The result is previewed on the LCD screen, so users can see in advance how their final image will look. Plus, a new Effect Shot feature automatically captures two shots simultaneously: one without effect, and one with a preselected Picture Style or Creative Filter effect. This makes it easy to see how each effect changes the photo without compromising the original image. Effect Shot mode is available in both Live View and viewfinder-based shooting, and can easily be viewed immediately in playback mode.

THE RIGHT MODE FOR THE RIGHT SITUATION.
NEW SPECIAL SCENE MODES: KIDS, FOOD AND CANDLELIGHT
The EOS Rebel SL1 has three new easily accessible scene modes to capture the perfect image the first time. Kids mode ensures high-speed shutter priority, focus tracking, healthy skin tones and flash when needed; Food mode delivers bright, vivid food images, limits flash by default and limits the red tint often associated with "restaurant plate" photography. With Candlelight mode, the camera will take care not to blow out the scene, maintaining the glow of the candle, leaving the flash off and reducing exposure fluctuation.

FLEXIBLE AND RELIABLE RECORDING.
COMPATIBILITY WITH SD/SDHC/SDXC MEMORY CARDS, INCLUDING ULTRA HIGH SPEED CARDS
The EOS Rebel SL1 uses popular SD, SDHC, SDXC, and is even compatible with Ultra High Speed (UHS-I), memory cards. Compact and available in large capacities, SD, SDHC and SDXC memory cards are a perfect complement to the camera's compact design.

Additionally, the EOS Rebel SL1 is compatible with Eye-Fi* SD cards, which are outfitted with a Wi-Fi® transmitter (IEEE 802.11b/g) and an internal antenna for wireless, high-speed transfer of images. With an Eye-Fi card installed, the EOS Rebel SL1 can display the Eye-Fi's connection status and error notes with ease, for fully functional wireless uploading of images directly from the camera.

* Canon cameras are not guaranteed to support Eye-Fi card functions, including wireless transfer. In case of an issue with the Eye-Fi card, please consult with the card manufacturer. The use of Eye-Fi cards may not be available outside the United States and Canada; please contact the card manufacturer for territory availability.

A COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF OPTICS PERFECT FOR VIDEO AND STILLS.
COMPATIBLE WITH EF AND EF-S LENSES
The EOS Rebel SL1 is compatible with all Canon lenses in the EF lineup, including compact and lightweight EF-S lenses, ranging from ultra-wide angle to super telephoto lenses and including the STM series, like the new EF-S 18–55mm f/3.5–5.6 IS STM, optimized for video shooting. Canon lenses employ advanced optical expertise and micron-precision engineering to deliver outstanding performance and deliver beautiful results. Special technologies like Canon's Optical Image Stabilizer help to minimize the effect of camera shake, effectively adding up to four stops of light; STM lenses even feature a stepping motor for smooth and quiet continuous autofocus while capturing video. With an array of lenses perfect for travel, sports, still life and everything in between, photographers can truly maximize the quality and performance of their EOS Rebel SL1.

MORE FEATURES FOR INCREASED VERSATILITY.
LENS ABERRATION CORRECTION
The EOS Rebel SL1 features lens correction tools that compensate for lens characteristics that can affect overall image quality. The EOS Rebel SL1's lens peripheral illumination correction feature corrects light falloff in the corner of the image according to the characteristics of the lens being used. It even has correction data for a number of popular lenses stored in its memory. With the EOS Rebel SL1's chromatic aberration correction tool, distracting color fringing can be corrected at the time of shooting.

FEATURE GUIDE
To help explain the specific function of features found on the EOS Rebel SL1, the Feature Guide displays a simple description helpful in determining the applicability for the situation at hand. It is displayed in each shooting mode, during mode dial operations, and for Quick Control screen functions. It appears automatically when a function is selected – a lifesaver when trying to determine the best mode or function for the next picture. The feature guide works automatically by default, and can be disabled easily through the camera's menu.

GPS COMPATIBLE
With the optional GPS Receiver GP-E2 attached to the hot shoe or the digital terminal, the EOS Rebel SL1 can record location, including latitude, longitude and altitude, and has the ability to track the trajectory of movement with its logging function. An electric compass records the camera's orientation during each shot, and world time information is recorded through GPS syncing.

JPEG RESIZING
To create images suitable for sharing by email or online, the EOS Rebel SL1 can resize JPEG files, in-camera, of varying pixels (aspect ratio cannot be changed, only the image size can be decreased) while leaving the original image untouched.

PHOTOBOOK SET-UP
Photographers can share their images in book form with the EOS Rebel SL1's convenient Photobook Set-up feature. Users can easily choose specific images, images in a folder and even all images, then specify their sequence and layout. The results can be printed in book form with ease.

IMAGE RATING
To help organize images recorded to the camera's storage, the EOS Rebel SL1 makes it simple to rate individual images from one star to five. Therefore, image browsing, printing and slide shows can be based upon those ratings.

CROPPING
Eliminating the need to post-process in the computer, photographers can easily crop their photos right in the EOS Rebel SL1. Perfect for direct connection to a printer, or in situations when it wasn't possible to zoom in enough with a zoom lens, cropping is a viable solution thanks to the camera's excellent 18.0-megapixel resolution. Users can choose vertical or horizontal images, and 3:2, 4:3, 16:9, even 1:1 aspect ratios.
